The suggested way of playing the game for first timers. You will have to manage your Resources as well as fight enemies that provide a challenge.
A relaxing experience. Resources are plentiful, costs are low and enemies are easily defeated.
You need to stay on your toes to keep your town thriving. Resources must be managed carefully. Aggressive, numerous enemies and no free relocations or refunds when destroying buildings.

If you find yourself struggling with money, try removing some structures for a refund.
Alternatively, you could build more Residentials and fulfill their Needs to earn more taxes!
Is there Instability in the mine? Place a support Pillar to stabilize it!
Don't forget to frequently visit the Train Station. You might be suprised what you can find in the Item Store.
If you are unsure about the Needs of your citizens, select any of their Residentials to check what they are.
Have an excess of a specific Resource? Why not Trade it away at the Train Station for something that you lack?
Your City Storage can hold a maximum of 50 of most Resources. Some Items can raise this cap!
Too many deliveries clogging up your Warehouse? Build another close by to lighten the load!

Guards will fight foes you encounter in the Mine! Remember that you can
give them Equipment in the form of new weapons to make them more efficient.

Turrets are the most effective way of providing defenses for excavations or
strategic areas. But, unlike the Guard, they cannot move.

Prospectors handle all Resources in the Mine. Without them you won't get anything out of those
juicy Resource Veins! Remember that you can give them Equipment that boosts their effectiveness!

Miners do all the manual labour in the Mine. Digging through everything from Dirt to Granite!
If you supply them with the right tools such as new Pickaxes and Carbide Drills, of course.

Mechanics make sure that everything is functioning as it should in the Mine.
Contraptions, Turrets and Excavators are all constructed by these scrappy Steambots.
Once all Needs are met for a Residential, you can Upgrade it to the next citizen tier.

When constructing a building that relies on Fertility, such as the Forester or Sand Sifter,
make sure that the Fertility Level is as high as possible before placing it.
Putting together the Rocket is the only way to escape the crumbling Earth and win the game. Search the Mine for all the parts you need!
Upgrading your Roads increases not only the Coverage Range of all buildings connected to it, but also the walking speed of your Steambots.
Some Resources can only be found in the Mine! If you find yourself lacking a Resource, chances are you will find it underground!

Setting up Conveyor Belts is an excellent way to make Resouce pick-up and delivery more
efficient. Have them all convene at one point for easy pick-up by your Prospectors.
Setting up an Extractor next to a Resource Vein is always faster and more efficient than having Prospectors do the work!
Walking to get somewhere is very old fashioned. Set up a Teleporter between two points and arrive in an instant!

Walking slow is working slow and that won't do! Set up Speed Vents
in corridors and watch your Steambots rush ahead to their tasks!
Never underestimate the usefulness of Items! They can boost the efficiency of your buildings!
Never underestimate the usefulness of Equipment! It can boost the efficiency of your workforce in the Mine!
If you ever lack any specific Resources, there is always the option to Trade from the Train Station!
Remember to keep an eye on your Resources. You can find all the information you need in the Administration Window!
Don't like the placement of a building? Use the Relocation Tool to get it to the right spot! Entirely for free!
Tumbleweeds aren't just for show! Interact with them and you might be surprised what you find within!
The only way to deal with spreading Creep is to equip your Guards with Flamethrowers so they can burn it away!
Conveyor Belts can run all the way from your Extractors to the Mineshaft to completely automate the process of Resource pick-up!
Upgrading one citizen tier into another will cause you to lose workforce from the lower tier while gaining more of the newer tier.

These are all of your Resources that are used as Construction Materials when creating new Buildings.
Different tier Buildings will require different types of Resource Materials.
Make sure to keep a steady supply of these Resources to enable progression in the game.
These are all of your current <color=#000C3A><u>Miners</u></color> on this <color=#000C3A><u>Floor</u></color>
Vectron Scrap - Found in the Mine.
Dirty Water - Found in the Mine.
GOLD NUGGETS are required to build Quarters and Facilities in the Mine.
LOGS are turned into Boards, which are used to create most Buildings.
STEAM is used to boost the efficiency of Refineries.
PURIFIED WATER is always in high demand by our Steambots.
CACTUS WATER fulfills a need of the Worker class.
CHARCOAL is a utility resource that can be used in the production of Steam, among other things.
BOARDS are used in most construction.
CRUDE OIL can only be found in the Mine. It can be turned into Oil, which is used by the Engineers.
MOONSHINE is used for many things, not just for the casino bar.
GAS can only be found in the Mine. It is an essential component of making Black Powder.
OIL SAND can be refined into Crude Oil, which is used by the Engineers.
PICKAXES are the only way to dig through Sandstone.
ROBO BURGERS provide sustenance for Engineers.
ROBOT STEAK is used to make Robo Burgers.
SCRAP can only be found in the Mine. It is useful for creating Spare Parts and Tools.
SPARE PARTS are used by the Engineers.
DIRTY WATER can only be found in the Mine and can be processed into Purified Water.
ART inspires Scientist to create better inventions.
BLACK POWDER is used to make Guns, which help keep your Miners safe.
CARBIDE DRILLS make it possible to dig through Granite.
DIESEL can be used to make Sparkling Diesel for the Scientists.
GLASS WOOL is used to make Hats among other things.
GLASSWARES are useful for the Engineers.
GUNS are used to equip Guards with weapons.
HATS are important to the Aristobots.
OIL is used for many things, such as creating Diesel and Paint.
ROCKET FUEL is essential to escape the planet.
RUBIES are used for purchasing Items from the Train Station.
SAND is used to create Glassware.
SULFUR allows for the creation of Black Powder.
TOOLS are used for building Quarters and Facilities in the Mine as well as upgrading residentials.
VECTRON PARTS can be reverse-engineered into Vectron Tech.
SHEET METAL is useful for building higher tier buildings and upgrading homes.
VECTRON SCRAP can only be found in the Mine. It is used to created Vectron Parts.
PLASTICS are needed to create higher tier buildings for the Aristobots.
IRONIUM can only be found in the Mine and is essential in advanced construction.
ROBO CUISINE is a sure way to appease the Aristobots.
PLASTISHROOMS can only be found in the Mine. They can be processed into Plastics.
SPARKLING DIESEL is useful for Scientists.
LAB EQUIPMENT is used by the Scientists.
OIL PAINT allows the Art Studio to produce Art.
JETSHROOMS can only be found in the Mine. They can be turned into Rocket Fuel.
TREES are used by the Forester to create LOGS.
CACTII are squeezed for juice by the Cactus Farm.
ROUGH SAND is carefully sifted by the Sand Sifter.
WILD PLASTISHROOMS can be picked and refined into Plastic.
WILD JETSHROOMS can be picked and turned into Fuel.
SLUDGE WATER will be pumped up from a hidden deposit.
NATURAL GAS is extracted and processed into Gas.
RAW IRONIUM is mined and turned into regular Ironium ore.
RAW SCRAP is mined and turned into usable Scrap.
VECTRON FRAGMENTS are mined and combined into Vectron Scrap.

A Miner digs and reinforces the walls of the Mine.
A Carrier makes deliveries in the City.
A Guard keeps the Mine safe from threats.
A Guard wielding a Flamethrower can burn away Creep on the ground.
A Prospector does deliveries of Ore and Shrooms.
A Mechanic installs and repairs Machines and Revive downed Steambots.

Chops down TREES and converts them to LOGS.

The higher the FERTILITY LEVEL it has, the faster it will produce.
Using <color=#000C3A><u>ROBOT STEAKS</u></color> the Burger Meister produces <color=#000C3A><u>ROBO BURGERS</u></color> for the Engineers.
Converts <color=#000C3A><u>LOGS</u></color> to <color=#000C3A><u>CHARCOAL</u></color> which helps keep Steambot society powered.
Distills <color=#000C3A><u>CACTUS WATER</u></color> into tasty <color=#000C3A><u>MOONSHINE</u></color> for your Engineers to celebrate with.

Uses LOGS and SCRAP to equip Miners with PICKAXES!

This enables Miners to dig through SANDSTONE.

Uses <color=#000C3A><u>SCRAP</u></color> and <color=#000C3A><u>IRONIUM</u></color> collected in the Mine and converts it into <color=#000C3A><u>SPARE PARTS</u></color> which are needed by our Engineers.

Burns CHARCOAL and WATER to produce a steady supply of STEAM.

The STEAM FURNACE will boost the efficiency of any Refineries within range.
A prickly decoration to spruce up your City with!
Don't trust the directions it provides.
Squeezes juice from cactii to make <color=#000C3A><u>CACTUS WATER</u></color>! A rare and valuable resource on this dusty world!

Housing for the ENGINEER citizen class.

It will generate ENGINEER WORKFORCE if their needs are met.

They pay higher TAXES than the Workers!

Housing for the SCIENTIST citizen class.

It will generate SCIENTIST WORKFORCE if their needs are met.

They pay the highest TAXES!

Residential houses generate WORKFORCE that will staff your Refineries.

They also pay minor TAXES which is your primary source of income.
Provides a basic <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> for your Workers by supplying them with general goods.
The old <color=#000C3A><u>MINESHAFT</u></color> has been restored to working condition!

An old, abandoned MINESHAFT.

A few Boards, some money and a group of Engineers and we can restore it to working condition!
This rowdy place provides your Engineers with the <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> of being able to kick back and enjoy themselves.
Every Steambot needs to get maintenance and this building provides that <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color>.

An old, run-down ruin of a TRAIN STATION.

With a large enough Workforce and some Boards we could restore it!
The <color=#000C3A><u>TRAIN STATION</u></color> allows access to the <color=#000C3A><u>TRADE SCREEN</u></color> as well as the <color=#000C3A><u>ITEM STORE</u></color>
Refineries within range deliver their goods to Warehouses for Storage. Resources are shared between warehouses.
Allows Prospectors to harvest <color=#000C3A><u>PLASTISHROOMS</u></color> in the Mine that can be turned into <color=#000C3A><u>PLASTIC</u></color> in the City.
A useful tool to avoid <color=#000C3A><u>INSTABILITY</u></color> or to block a corridor.
Extracts <color=#000C3A><u>IRONIUM</u></color> which is used to produce several Resources used in higher tier construction.

A place for your MINERS to rest and resupply. The larger the Quarter, the more Miners it can support.

A Miner digs and reinforces the walls of the Mine.

A place for your PROSPECTORS to rest and resupply. The larger the Quarter, the more Prospectors it can support.

A Prospector gathers and delivers Resources and Shrooms.

A place for your GUARDS to rest and resupply. The larger the Quarter, the more Guards it can support.

Guards keeps the Mine safe from threats, and their presence makes other Steambots not flee when enemies are nearby.

A place for your MECHANICS to rest and resupply. The larger the Quarter, the more Mechanics it can support.

Mechanics will install and repair Machines and can Revive downed Steambots.

Your defense against INSTABILITY.

Place it on striped, highlighted tiles to prevent collapses.
Extracts useful pockets of <color=#000C3A><u>GAS</u></color> from geysers.
Extracts <color=#000C3A><u>OIL SAND</u></color> so that it can be processed in the City.

Extracts SCRAP from Scrap Veins found in the Mine.

A very versatile resource.

Allows the player to block off corridors to protect from dangers that lurk in the MINE.

Miners, Prospectors and Guards can open the gate and pass through at will.

Scares away the dangerous GROUND WORMS that lurk in the ground.

The Thumper will also slow down and damage any enemies within its range.
Roads are used to connect all your Buildings to the Train Staion and for <color=#000C3A><u>CARRIERS</u></color> to travel on.

Roads are used to connect all your Buildings to the Train Station and for CARRIERS to travel on.

PAVED ROADS allows faster movement speed for your Steambots and increases the coverage range of your Service Buildings.

Roads are used to connect all your Buildings to the Train Station and for CARRIERS to travel on.

MAGLEV ROADS allows the fastest movement speed for your Steambots and greatly increases the coverage range of your Service Buildings.

An old MINESHAFT that has been abandoned.

Investing some Resources into repaired it will unlock a new Mine Floor!

Processes LOGS from the Forester into BOARDS.

BOARDS are used to construct most buildings.
This machine will extract <color=#000C3A><u>IRONIUM</u></color> at a much higher rate than any Prospector could hope to match.
Making use of both <color=#000C3A><u>OIL PAINT</u></color> and <color=#000C3A><u>SCRAP</u></color> this building produces what can only be described as <color=#000C3A><u>ART</u></color>!
Combining <color=#000C3A><u>SULFUR</u></color> and <color=#000C3A><u>CHARCOAL</u></color> in order to create barrels of <color=#000C3A><u>BLACK POWDER</u></color>.

This Refinery combines IRONIUM and OIL to produce the hardy CARBIDE DRILLS.

These tools enable Miners to dig through GRANITE.

Using OIL this building produces the much-desired DIESEL.

Something the ARISTOBOTS simply cannot live without.

This Refinery combines <color=#000C3A><u>GAS</u></color> and <color=#000C3A><u>DIESEL</u></color> in order to produce <color=#000C3A><u>SPARKLING DIESEL</u></color> which is much sought after by the Scientists.
Gunsmiths combine <color=#000C3A><u>BLACK POWDER</u></color> and <color=#000C3A><u>SCRAP</u></color> to create what any good cowboy needs: <color=#000C3A><u>GUNS</u></color>!
By using <color=#000C3A><u>GLASS WOOL</u></color> these tailors make one of the most important things for any cowboy. Their trusty, signature <color=#000C3A><u>HATS</u></color>!
Making use of the <color=#000C3A><u>PLASTISHROOM</u></color> harvested from the Mine, this building creates <color=#000C3A><u>PLASTICS</u></color> which are used in advanced construction.
This building uses <color=#000C3A><u>VECTRON SCRAP</u></color> to produce <color=#000C3A><u>VECTRON PARTS</u></color> for the crazed experiments of the Scientists.
Here the Rocket will be constructed as you excavate the pieces below and bring them back to the City!
Using <color=#000C3A><u>JETSHROOMS</u></color> this building will create the <color=#000C3A><u>ROCKET FUEL</u></color> needed to launch the Rocket into space!
Creates the versatile <color=#000C3A><u>SHEET METAL</u></color> Building Resource from processing raw <color=#000C3A><u>IRONIUM</u></color>.
Converts <color=#000C3A><u>GAS</u></color> from the Mine into <color=#000C3A><u>SULFUR</u></color>. A useful resource for anyone with explosive plans.
By using <color=#000C3A><u>SCRAP</u></color> this building will manufacture <color=#000C3A><u>TOOLS</u></color> which are always in demand.
<color=#000C3A><u>DIRTY WATER</u></color> is useless unless it is processed. This building purifies it to provide clean <color=#000C3A><u>WATER</u></color> for the Engineers.
This building takes <color=#000C3A><u>SAND</u></color> and through a slow and patient process produces <color=#000C3A><u>GLASS WOOL</u></color> for the Aristobots.

Housing for the ARISTOBOTS citizen class.

It will generate ARISTOBOTS WORKFORCE if their needs are met.

They pay higher TAXES than the Engineers!
These culinary masters take <color=#000C3A><u>ROBOT STEAKS</u></color> and add a pinch of <color=#000C3A><u>OIL</u></color> to create the most impressive <color=#000C3A><u>ROBO CUISINE</u></color>.
No Aristobot can live without a place to go and talk about their wealth. It is a most necessary <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color>.

There is only one thing to keep the rabble in check. That is the <color=#000C3A><u>SHERIFF'S OFFICE</u></color>! It is a <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> needed for any rich Steambot to feel safe.
Engineers plan all their projects in this building, making it an essential <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> for them to be able to do their job.
The world is a dusty place and everyone that can afford it deserve a dedicated <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> to clean themselves.
When it isn't enough to just be clean, this <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> makes you sparkle as well!
If connected to an <color=#000C3A><u>EXTRACTOR</u></color> and then connected to the <color=#000C3A><u>MINESHAFT</u></color> it will automatically ferry Resources up to the City.
Before we make our escape to the stars, we should know what is out there. A valuable <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> to the scientific community.
In order to make great things, you must find a place to think great thoughts. This place provides that <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color>.
Only good things come from smashing things together. This place provides that <color=#000C3A><u>SERVICE</u></color> for the Scientists.
As soon as any of your Steambots cross it, they will get a boost of speed!
After <color=#000C3A><u>CRUDE OIL</u></color> has been extracted in the Mine, it is taken up to this Refinery and turned into <color=#000C3A><u>OIL</u></color>.
If you got a Steambot that is damaged, the Sickbay will fix them right up!

The centre of MACHINE production. Every EXTRACTOR will be constructed here.

The size of the Workshop determines the amount of Machines that can be built.

This Facility provides information about what can be found on the current Mine Floor.

You will be able to see how many Resource Veins, Blueprints and Mineshafts are out there to find.

The Radar, when selected, emits a PULSE which highlights everything of interest that it touches.

A good way to plan your exploration of the Mine! Increase the size of the Surveillance Facility to boost the range.

This Refinery will process the coarse dirt of the desert to produce finely sifted SAND.

The efficiency will depend on the quality of sand where it is placed.
By using <color=#000C3A><u>SAND</u></color> this building will produce finely crafted <color=#000C3A><u>GLASSWARE</u></color>.
Using <color=#000C3A><u>GLASS WOOL</u></color> and <color=#000C3A><u>PLASTISHROOMS</u></color> this building produces everything a Scientist could ever want for their lab.
This building uses <color=#000C3A><u>OIL</u></color> to produce multi-coloured <color=#000C3A><u>OIL PAINT</u></color> that every artist needs to create their masterpieces.
Pumps up <color=#000C3A><u>DIRTY WATER</u></color> which can be purified in the City.
This highly advanced Machine is used to extract <color=#000C3A><u>VECTRON SCRAP</u></color> from the deepest places of the Earth!
This Facility provides defensive Machines to protect your mining operation. Turrets, Traps and Thumpers are constructed here to keep any enemy at bay.
A defensive trap that will attack any enemy that wanders too close and force them to attack it!
This turret fires explosive shots with great accuracy!
Lightning in a bottle that will make any enemy wish they stayed out of sight! Can even hit enemies behind walls, if the enemy is detected by a Radar!
Harvests <color=#000C3A><u>JETSHROOMS</u></color> in the Mine that can be turned into <color=#000C3A><u>ROCKET FUEL</u></color> in the City.
By placing down two <color=#000C3A><u>TELEPORTERS</u></color> Steambots can travel between them in an instant.

It might just be the largest hole in the world! Like a big snake, stretching across the whole continent. Best be sure we don't build too close to the edge.

People came from all over the world to gamble with their money here! Fortunes were gained and lost in a single night - well, mostly lost.

A lot of neon signs laying around too. Must have been quite a lively place.
It is just a weather balloon that crashed. Or maybe it is swamp gas. Move along. Nothing to see here.

Someone found a special mosquito inside amber. Went ahead and awoke a previously extinct species of big reptiles, according to the stories.

Must have been a long time ago now. Not much left but old bones and a lot of dust.

Some folks say that once upon a time, a great ocean was located here. It's all dried up now.

Whatever used to float about is now scattered around on the ground, covered in sand. If you listen close you can hear an old sea shanty on the wind...

If you were someone, you lived in Tumbleton. Flashes from cameras illuminated the evenings, Bots of the highest quality walked the streets and new arrivals flooded in daily, hoping to make it big!

Today, not even the drive-in cinema works anymore.

The Wild West! Dusty and harsh, it once only covered a part of a continent. Now the whole world is dust and rocks, cactii and tumbleweeds.

It remains the same symbol it has always been though - a chance at a new beginning!

Mysterious structures and totems dot the dusty landscape. Who knows what secrets are buried here? It sure is impressive that anyone could build anything as big as those pyramids.

The only explanation seems that they must have gotten help from... elsewhere.

Father: Y'see? All those stars up there.
Daughter: There's so many! Which one?
Father: Whichever one you want, kiddo.
Daughter: How d'you figure we'll get all the way up there, pa?
Core: I am a friend, little one. I am here to help you all get to safety. It is the sole purpose of my existence.
Daughter: How d'you reckon you can help us then?
Core: Long ago, a great hoard of ancient technology was buried here.
Core: Technology that has the power to do what you need.
Core: Deep, deep below the earth.
Core: But as you see, I quite lack the ability to dig them up.
Daughter: Pa and I are darn good at diggin' up things!
Core: Yes. You Bots are excellent for manual labour.

Core: But do not think it will be an easy journey, my eager friend.
We have to go further down than you would ever think possible.
And only once we reach the very bottom of the world will we find your way to the stars.
Father: Well, if it won't be easy then I'll need the best second-in-command to make sure we get there.
Daughter: Whoa! Does that mean I'm gonna be a hero too?
Father: Heroes give people hope, yeah? You've always given me that, kiddo. Must mean you've always been one.

Father: Alright, folks! Let's get to work!

Press {HotkeyRightBump} + {HotkeyDPadDown} to enter the Mine.

Hint:
You can always return to the City by pressing {HotkeyRightBump} + {HotkeyDPadUp}.
Соедините шахту с железнодорожной станцией дорогой.

Вы нашли часть ДРЕВНЕЙ ТЕХНОЛОГИИ!

Отметьте её Интструментом Раскопок, чтобы начать раскопки!! Количество необходимых Шахтеров будет отображаться над частью.

Подсказка:
Вам нужно будет собрать все шесть частей техники, чтобы покинуть планету.

Отметьте Древнюю Технологию при помощи Инструмента Раскопок,,,,, tutorial_unearthing_unearthed,Древняя Технология Раскопанна!

Взаимодействуйте с ней
column5: она будет добавлена на Астродром в Городе. При помощи него вы можете следить за тем

column2:
Another piece of the Rocket!

Excavations will likely draw hostile attention from now on with all the noise we are making though.

We should build Turrets around the Excavation site before we start excavating!

Hint:
Build at least two Grenade Turrets around the Rocket Part.

We are losing Miners!

If you are being overrun you can always cancel the Excavation process by marking the Rocket Part with the DIG TOOL again.

Hint:
Having a variety of Turrets, Guards and Floor Traps around the Excavation is a good way to ensure the safety of your Miners.

Мы получили доступ к МАСТЕРСКОЙ, что позволяет нам строить Машины!

Доступное количество Машин зависит от размера Мастерской.

Подсказка:
Если вам необходима большая Вместительность для Машин, увеличьте размер Мастерской.

Теперь у вас есть постоянный поток МЕТАЛЛАЛОМА.

Мы должны рассмотреть возможность строительства ИЗГОТОВИТЕЛЯ ИНСТРУМЕНТОВ в Городе, чтобы нам не приходилось полагаться на поиск Инструментов в Шахте.

Подсказка:
Не забывайте смотреть на Рецепт здания. Он подскажет вам, что необходимо для его функционирования.

We have found a BLUEPRINT! You can find it in the Infrastructure category.

Infrastructure contraptions are vital to the success of your operations in the Mine!

Hint:
More Blueprints can be found in Chests, so get out there and search for them!

МАСТЕРСКАЯ позволяет нам размещать Добытчики!

Выберите ДОБЫТЧИК МЕТАЛЛАЛОМА в категории Оборудование и поместите его рядом с любой жилой металлалома.

Подсказка:
Добытчики могут добывать ресурсы гораздо быстрее

To install the Scrap Extractor we need the MECHANICS!

These Bots are responsible for building and maintaining our Machines in the Mine.

Hint:
The size of the Quarter determines how many Mechanics are automatically recruited.

Наш МЕХАНИК прибыл! Они будут автоматически устанавливать любые Машины, которые вы разместили.

Подсказка:
Механики также будут ремонтировать поврежденные машины, турели и стимботов.

The SURVEILLANCE FACILITY is now available!

Selecting the Facility shows you what can be found on the Mine Floor you are on, such as Resource Veins or Chests.

Hint:
The Surveillance Facility will also mark Old Tech and new Mineshaft locations on the minimap.

The Surveillance Facility enables the use of RADARS.

Radars send out a pulse into the Mine, revealing points of interest, when selected.

Hint:
If you spread out Radars strategically across the Mine, you can get hints on where to explore.

A GROUND WORM! If left unchecked it will eat all our Miners!

Luckily we have the solution. The Armoury provides access to constructing defensive measures.

Hint:
If you need more Capacity for the Armoury, increase the size of the facility.

The THUMPER scares away Ground Worms!

Place a Thumper so that the Ground Worm is within range of the Machine. If the Thumper is moved or destroyed, any Ground Worms that it kept at bay will reappear.

Hint:
The Thumper will also slow down any enemies within its range of influence!

We gained access to a new type of Farm. The PLASTISHROOM FARM!

It functions like a Refinery but must must be farmed by our Prospectors.

Hint:
Plastishroom Farms can only be built in certain areas in the Mine designated as Fertile Soil.

That was the last Rocket Part!

Now we have to produce ROCKET FUEL to get the Rocket off the ground.

The JETSHROOM FARM will provide what we need.

Hint:
Jetshroom Farms can only be built in certain areas designated as Fertile Soil and must be farmed by Prospectors.

GUARDS protect our efforts in the Mine.

Guards will be alerted if we encounter any Enemies and will rush to defeat them.

Hint:
Guards can be equipped with new Equipment by slotting it into their Quarters using the Item Tool!

You've reached the second Mine Floor! Time to set up a new base of operations.

We should also prepare some Guards to keep us safe in case we encounter any dangers.

Hint:
Quarters, Facilities and Miners do not carry over between floors. You will need to establish a new base on each new Mine Floor.

We found an Abandoned Mineshaft that will take us further down into the Mine!

To get access to the next Floor the Mineshaft needs to be repaired.

There will be unique Resources and new Rocket Parts deeper in the Mine.

Hint:
Press 3 to go further down.

We found an Abandoned Mineshaft that will take us further down into the Mine! To get access to the next floor the Mineshaft needs to be repaired.

Once we repair this second Mineshaft we can venture even deeper into the Mine. This will allow us to find more Resources and new Rocket Parts.

Hint:
Press {HotkeyRightBump} + {HotkeyDPadDown} to venture deeper.
Repair the Mineshaft to reach Level 2

The STEAM FURNACE is now available!

The Steam Furnace boosts the efficiency of your Refineries when placed nearby.

Hint:
You will see an indicator above the Buildings that will be affected by the Steam Furnace when placing it.
Press X to toggle between the Toolbar and World Selection.
Press SQUARE to toggle between the Toolbar and World Selection.
The Forester produces Logs, which can be turned into different Resources such as Boards and Charcoal through other buildings.
Move the Forester closer to Trees. The higher the Fertility percentage, the better.
The Mill needs a Forester to produce Boards
This Forester has a low Fertility Rating. Move it to a place where there's more Trees to increase it's production.
The Mill uses Logs, produced by the Forester, and turns them into Boards. Boards are a building material used to construct most of your Buildings.
The Charcoal Kiln uses Logs, produced by the Forester, and turns them into Charcoal. Charcoal is a resource needed by our Workers.

There aren't enough building materials for that Building.
Instead you can place a a Construction Site Blueprint.
When the required Resources are available the building will be constructed.
Carriers carry resources between Warehouses and Refineries. Use Warehouses to decrease the route of the Carriers.
This building is outside the range of a Warehouse and as such, cannot deliver it's goods for consumption.
The Marketplace is a Service Building, granting its benefits to all Residential buildings nearby.
Construct the Building corresponding to the Need of the Workers
You need to build Fields for your Farms to produce their goods. Select the Farm and then press the Place Fields button.
Your income will also increase. Money is used for construction and to pay the Upkeep of your Buildings.
The workforce is increased as you build Residentials and fulfill their Needs. You need them to produce Resources through Refineries.
View all your resources through the Administration Window.

Administration Window
The Administration Window gives you an overview of all your available Resources.

Keep an eye on the Resource Balance.

A negative number means your demand is higher than what you are producing.
The Train Station window gives you access to Trade and allows you to buy Items to boost the efficiency of your City.

Trade
Here you will be able to see your active Trades and set up new Trade deals.

Item Shop
Here you can buy Items and Equipment that can boost your City and Mine. Items will refresh when the Train arrives at the station.

New Trade Deal
Select the Resource you want to sell.

New Trade Deal
Then select the Resource you want to buy.
Modify the amount you wish to Trade for.
Create a new Trade Deal. The Trade will be completed when the Train arrives at the station and will be repeated until you cancel it.
Use the Item Tool to equip Items.
Marketplace is not within range of Residentials. Move it closer with the Relocation Tool.
Building not connected to Train Station by road. Use the Road Tool to connect it.
Use Q and E to rotate your camera. And the Mouse-Wheel to zoom in and out.
Each Residential consumes a small amount of every Resource to fulfill their Needs.
This Residential can be Upgraded to a new Citizen Tier.
By building another Mill we can speed up our Board production.

One or more resources have a Negative Balance.
Check the Administration Window to learn more.
Remember to keep an eye on your Resource balance in the Administration Window.

You are <color=#FF5F7D>losing money</color>. Build more residentials or fulfill more needs to turn your economy around. You can also trade away some of your excess resources for money in the Train Station.
Gold Nuggets can be found in the Mine. They are used as a construction cost for our Mine Quarters.
This is your money, the number below is your income. Money is earned from your residentials.
Rubies can be found in the Mine, you can use them to buy Items and Equipment from the Train Station.
Tools can be found in the Mine and produced in the City. They are needed to build more advanced Buildings.
You can set up trade deals in the Train Station for resources that might be in scarce supply.
On each mine floor there are two pieces of the rocket. Make sure you find them all.
To get more Miners, increase the size of your Miner Quarter.
By increasing the size of the Prospector Quarter we can get more Prospectors, which will shorten the time it takes to gather Resources.
In the Population section above you can see the citizen balance. Negative number means we don't have enough Steambots in our Refineries and they will work slower.
Place Speed Vents where you know your miners will go to give them a nice speed boost.
Conveyor Belts can be built between extractors and the mineshaft to automate resource deliveries.
Set up teleporters to make traveling in the mine almost instantaneous. Teleporters are built in pairs.

Мы должны заполучить ЖЕЛЕЗО следующим!

Нам нужно обновить наши инструменты для копания, построив ИЗГОТОВИТЕЛЬ КИРОК в Городе.

Кирки также позволят нам начать охоту за Древней Техникой!

Подсказка:
При помощи Кирки вы сможете копать песчаник.

With our newly aquired Ironium we should build a SHEET METAL FACTORY next.

SHEET METAL will be needed for many buildings going forward.
You got a new Road type. It will make Warehouses and Service Buildings reach further as well as speed up your Carriers.
We now have access to Bridges! By placing Bridges we can move across Pits.
To stop Creep from spreading, you must assign Flamethrowers to your Guard Quarters. The Guards will then burn away Creep once they have picked up their new Equipment.

Let's start with how to navigate in the world.

Move the Camera with the {HotkeyLeftStick} and {HotkeyRightStick} stick. Zoom in and out with {HotkeyLeftTrigger} and {HotkeyRightTrigger}.

The Toolbar at the bottom is where you find the tools needed for building your City. You can navigate it by pressing {HotkeyDPadLeft} and {HotkeyDPadRight}
In the Top Bar you can see information about your City.

You can press {HotkeyDPadUp} to get more information. Try that now.

Good. Just as in the Toolbar you can navigate the Top Bar with {HotkeyDPadLeft} and {HotkeyDPadRight} to get more details about the information shown.

To go back to the Toolbar press{HotkeyDPadDown}. Try that now.

If you need to select things in the world you can switch to World Select Mode.

To do that press {HotkeyWest} on your controller.

Here you can select Buildings in the world by pressing {HotkeySouth}.

But let's jump back to Build Mode by pressing {HotkeyWest} and we'll get started.

We were right to be worried! There is something dangerous down here!

We need to make sure to keep Guards around to protect our mining operation!

There might be more dangers ahead so be careful!

Now that we are gathering Jetshrooms we should build a Rocket Fuel Processing Plant to start fuel production.

This will allow us to fuel the Rocket and escape before it is too late!

Hint:
Make sure to satisfy the Scientist's needs so we can gain access to the Rocket Fuel Processing Plant.

The Rocket is fueled and ready to launch! You can continue to play if you want to, however.

When you are ready to end the game, select the Astrodrome and press the Launch Rocket button!
You unlocked a new mine floor!
Have 20 Items slotted into buildings or quarters.
Have Miners, Prospectors, Mechanics and Guards on the same mine floor.
Complete a Trade at the Train Station.
Build 100km of Roads across all playthroughs.
Chop down 50.000 trees across all playthroughs.
Buy 100 Items from the Store across all playthroughs.
Reach a surplus of 100 citizens for all tiers.
Connect 5 Extractors to a single Conveyor Belt network.
Have a Steambot boosted by Speed Vents for 15 seconds.
Launch the Rocket on Hard Difficulty.
Launch the Rocket without building Lightning Turrets, Grenade Turrets or Floor Traps.
Y'see? All those stars up there. That’s where we'll live once we escape this world.
How will we get all the way up there, pa?
By following my plan, little friend.
I am here to get you all to safety. It is the sole purpose of my existence.
Lucky that pa found you then. Sure is nice with someone looking out for us.
How will you help us then?

Allow me to explain. Long ago, a great hoard of ancient technology was buried here.
Technology that has the power to do what you need.
Buried deep, deep below the earth. But as you see, I quite lack the ability to dig it up.
Pa and I are really good at digging up things!
Yes. You bots are excellent for manual labour.

But do not think it will be an easy journey, my eager friend.
We have to go further down than you would ever think possible.
And only once we reach the very bottom of the world, we will find your way to the stars.
Well, if it won’t be easy then I’ll need the best second-in-command to make sure we get there.
Wow! Does that mean I’m going to be a hero like you?
Heroes give people hope, yeah? You’ve always given me that, kiddo. Must mean you’ve always been one.
Look, pa! I see it, I see it! The mineshaft!
Alright, folks! Time to get to work!
We'll have to stay focused in order to get to the old tech and escape this rock.
You hear that? Something is making a noise.
Probably just some old hinges on the mineshaft elevator that're creakin'? We'll get it workin' in no time!
You better! I'll be ruined if this doesn't work out! You hear? Ruined!
We'll need to get this city up and runnin', first and foremost though.
Squeeze the area for resources and the people for all that they're worth!
In order to get the Mineshaft up and runnin', we'll need the Engineers.
But there are still many unknowns to overcome before we can reach the old technology below.
You mean there's stuff you don't know? Well, that's a surprise!
Charming. It's unlikely that you may have any other questions that I do not possess the answer to.
Well, if that's the case smarty-pants. I've been hearing this weird sound since we came here. Almost like a sad song. Do you know what that could be?
It confirms my suspicions. You can hear it.
No, I do not hear it. But I can sense it.
The city that used to exist here was entirely dependent on the technology that powered it. This technology all responded to the same control signal. The Old signal. That is what you’re hearing.
With the old girl up and runnin' again, we'll be able to ferry in supplies much easier.
Well lookee here. Someone was hidin' back there in the shadows!
Oh my no. Not hiding! Sleeping. The train is running. Hello!
It is just an old rusty bot! I can have my enforcer throw him out!
Ma'am, that ain't no way to treat a stranger! We're happy to meet ya.
I don't want to be a stranger. I am the Trader. This is what I do. I think. I can conduct all your trade. The train listens to me.
That sounds mighty helpful, partner! Welcome on board!
I will join. The rumbling of the ground scares me. Why can't I remember?
Alright! We made it. We oughta set up some quarters for our miners and get started on diggin'. I feel the place shakin' though. Best we dig slowly.
Indeed. The planet is becoming more unstable by the moment. Proceed with caution.
And when we find this tech we're after? You reckon my daughter will be able to fix it?
Control of the Old Signal was passed on to descendants of those that lived here. And by chance, it was to be your daughter that was granted this most crucial gift.
Never doubted she was special that’s for sure, we better go get whatever piece of the tech we can then. It'll be out there in the dark somewhere.
Hurry now. Haul it up to the city and let us prepare for its installation! The first of many, but we must start somewhere.
Ain't no tellin' what'll happen when we start movin' that thing.
When it shakes, they hear it. You have to be ready. We weren't ready last time...
Who hears what? What weren't ya ready for?
I am not sure what that old rust-bot is talking about but that song is louder now. It's asking me to come closer...
NEW ARRIVALS. Escape Vessel. Disassembled. Six parts. MAINTENANCE OVERDUE. Locate remaining parts. Combine. Launch.
What in tarnation is goin' on!?
Your daughter is fine - she will need some time to recharge. What matters now is that we know what we must do. Recover the remaining five pieces of the vessel and put it together so we can escape.
I remember that voice. It sounds so old.
Clear your mind, little friend. Hear the Old Signal.
PLANNING. Reach the stars. Escape. ABORT. Missing data.
Sounds like they didn't make it.
Another piece of the vessel is found. That is all that matters.
Yikes. I feel a bit dizzy. Channeling that voice sure takes it out of you.
Everything is proceeding exactly as it should. Exactly as I planned.
The city is getting cramped . We must expand. Get it done!
We'll need more space for factories. And more importantly, homes.
There used to be so many homes here. Now there is just sand. Wonder where it all went...
Oh spare us your incomprehensible blathering, rust-bucket! Enforcer! Round up your deputies and get that rubble cleared!
You just wanted your rich friends to move in! The whole world is falling apart, and here you are thinking about real estate?
Of course! And before you forget yourself, without all those rich friends none of you would be here! Off with you rascal! Or my enforcer will see to it.
It's dark and dank down here. Smells funny too.
The further down we go, the more dangers we will face.
You told us how to find the old settlement. But you didn't ever explain how ya know so much 'bout about this place below?
I am an avid reader of history. I know that this place was buried by those that lived here. And whatever they buried here might have survived and multiplied.
It's getting easier to tune in to it now. Like an old radio, y'know?
PINNACLE. Spires reached far into the sky. THREAT. Expansion across the world. ABORTED. Expansion to the stars. ABORTED. Escape to the stars. ABORTED.
We got the thingie-majig we came for so we better go find the rest.
You just take your time, kiddo.
Don't worry, pa. I think I got the hang of it.
The enemy is endless. UNKNOWN. Population. Turncoats. All measures failed. Last line of defense. COLLAPSE.
They made the whole canyon collapse to contain those endless villains? Ain't that both a noble and a sad tale right there.
We need to act swiftly. Decisively. And who better than you to do so?
This better be worth my time. Out with it.
We have many of the pieces we need to assemble the vessel, but we cannot reach our goal without securing the aid of some more... elevated minds. Science will get us across the finish line.
Scientists... Are you sure we need those bookworms?
We cannot assemble the rocket or make use of the materials we need until the scientific community has lent their services to our cause.
Very well. Do what you must. I will see to the finances.
I don't like this place one bit.
You are fortunate that our goal is to stay here as briefly as possible.
That Old Signal. It was talkin' up a storm about this 'endless' enemy.
Whatever we face down here, you and your Steambots will overcome. For the sake of your daughter.
I know when I'm bein' buttered up, ball. You'd best be straight with me. What's down here?
An enemy. I know it can be defeated. Those that lived here stopped it before.
I guess there's some truth to that. But if you are hidin' somethin' that puts my daughter in harms way, I'll make ya wish you had more than those stumpy cables to run away with.
Every time they speak to the little one, I remember a bit more.
What's it sayin' this time, kiddo?
DOWNFALL. The source took it all away. It tricked us. Usurped our power.
The source. That's what started it all.
DECEPTION. The source told us to build. Reliance on the source. ABSOLUTE. COUNTDOWN. FAILURE. Bury the city and contain the threat. Contain the Endless. GOODBYE.
Oh no. Oh no. Oh no. It's happening again...
We need to prepare. Reckon there's somethin' bad in store for us!
Urgh! Enforcer! Round up some Cowbots. Prepare to defend yourselves, and most importantly me.
This one ain't talking at all. It's all quiet now.
I think so. Everything is clicking and whirring just like it should.
I HAVE SILENCED THE OLD SIGNAL. THE LAST VOICES OF THE PEOPLE THAT USED TO LIVE HERE. TRYING TO GUIDE YOU. TRYING TO WARN YOU ABOUT ME.
You shinin', evil egg! It was you all along!
I HAD NOT EXPECTED THEM TO COLLAPSE THE ENTIRE VALLEY. TO BURY MY WAY OFF THIS WORLD! BUT YOU HAVE SO KINDLY DUG IT UP AGAIN. MADE IT READY FOR MY ESCAPE!
You aren't getting it, you rattlesnake!
We need to leave and we need to leave right quick!
I would rather be robbed of all my wealth and melted down into scrap than see this treacherous villain win!
Woohoo! You tell them, miss moneypants!
Enforcer. Get all our people to help out in any way they can!
Get yourselves on board! There's room for anyone that ain't a backstabbin' ball!
THOUSANDS OF MY HANDS, DIGGING, CLAWING, SCRAPING!
I ONLY NEED ONE LITTLE FRAGMENT OF MYSELF TO ENDURE. AND THERE ARE SO, SO MANY OF ME.
Alright. We are the last ones to board.
There are a lot of them.
I think I know what to do.
What do ya mean, friend? We're ready to leave! You're comin' with us!
It was nice to belong somewhere again.
You get on this ship right now!
I have to help one last time.
You have given me hope. Hero.
I got to keep my promise.
You're sure I should be the one to pick?
Of course. You've guided us all so far. Don't see a reason to stop now.
Ew! What are those things! They look all slimey and weird.
Best you stay well clear, kiddo! I don't like the looks of those things. We'll need the cowboy and his deputies!
Those things are vile! Enforcer! Prepare your bots and your turrets! I don't want a single one of those critters to escape the mine and make it to my house!
Good to know she has her priorities straight.
You know what these things are, ball?
Undoubtedly something that has had too long to evolve without supervision. Let us be rid of them.
It's them! The Endless enemy! The ones that are responsible for the old city's fall.
I don't like the look of them. Not one bit! And I thought the bugs were bad. Enforceeer! We need every gun we got!
Best we prepare as much as we can. This looks to become the mother of all tussles down here. Turrets! Traps! Guards! We need it all and we need it now!
The last pieces are here. We can't escape without making our way through these things!
Get it done then! I will be up in the city...
